comment: Yes . Imagine . The depth of thought we could develop . The structures for argument we could attend to . The techniques we could hone . The trust we could build and use to lift each other to new personal heights . <URL>

                        :ARG1-of (p2 / possible-01)))
            :op4 (t2 / technique
                  :ARG1-of (h / hone-01
                        :ARG0 w
                        :ARG1-of (p3 / possible-01)))
            :op5 (t3 / trust
                  :ARG1-of (b / build-01

                        :ARG1-of (u / use-01

                              :ARG2 (l / lift-01

                                    :ARG1 w2
                                    :ARG4 (h2 / high-02
                                          :ARG1-of (n / new-01)
                                          :ARG1-of (p4 / personal-02))))))))

comment: Seriously , break the class in two , while half the class is in the library doing assigned reading and writing , engage the other half of the class and vice versa .
amr:
# ::snt Seriously , break the class in two , while half the class is in the library doing assigned reading and writing , engage the other half of the class and vice versa .
(a / and
      :op1 (b / break-01
            :mode imperative
            :ARG0 (y / you)

                  :quant 2))
      :op2 (e / engage-01

            :ARG0 y
            :ARG1 (h / half

                  :op2 (w / write-01

      :ARG2-of (s / serious-01)

            :ARG1 (c4 / class
                  :ARG1-of (ii / include-91
                        :ARG3 "1/2"))
            :ARG2 (l / library)))
